author: Unreal Engine
description:
Watch this video recorded at GDC 2025 to learn how Kids Web Services (KWS) handles parental consent and verification in Fortnite. 

Kids Web Services has successfully verified over 25 million parents and supports billions of user settings for Fortnite and other large game account systems. 

Watch this video to discover KWS’ guiding principles on scalability, reliability, and appropriate data handling.  

Want to find out more about KWS? Take a look here: kidswebservices.com

#KidsWebServices, #KWS, #ParentalConsent, #AgeVerification, #Fortnite, #GDC2025
title: KWS: Scaling Parental Consent and Verification in Fortnite and Beyond | GDC 2025

author: Unreal Engine
description:
Watch this video recorded at GDC 2025 to explore the evolving Chaos Destruction system in Unreal Engine.

The Chaos Destruction system is a toolset that empowers artists to create dynamic destruction by defining how geometry fractures and interacts in simulations. 

Using tools that fracture geometry, define clustering models, and leverage strain evaluation, destructible assets respond to environmental forces, enabling realistic and controlled destruction.

Focusing on the latest features in Unreal Engine 5.5, this talk examines cost-effective methods for destroying geometry collections without excessive field usage, leveraging anchoring directly from the Fracture Mode and using Niagara Data Channels for gameplay interactivity. 

You’ll gain insight into propagation techniques, including break and shock propagation, and learn new workflows for enhancing destruction mechanics with improved simulation tools.

Whether you're anchoring assets, manipulating strain values for precise contro
title: Dynamic Destruction in UE5 with the Chaos Destruction System | GDC 2025

author: Unreal Engine
description:
Watch this video recorded at GDC 2025 for a look at how to avoid common pitfalls when developing AAA games in Unreal Engine. 

Three hundred talented people can work together, support each other, yet still miss something and make a mistake. This talk aims to break down common misconceptions, mistakes, and important considerations for AAA teams leveraging Unreal Engine for large-scale projects.

Want to find out more about AAA game development in Unreal Engine? Take a look here: unrealengine.com/uses/games

#AAAGames, #GameDevelopment, #BestPractices, #CommonPitfalls, #UnrealEngine, #GDC2025
title: Preempting Challenges in AAA Unreal Engine Development | GDC 2025

author: Unreal Engine
description:
Watch this video recorded at GDC 2025 for a beginner's guide to development in Unreal Engine. 

There are a lot of guides to switching to Unreal but it’s hard to know who to follow and what’s actually current. 

Enter Epic Games’ Matt Oztalay. Check out this video for a breakdown of core concepts and principles involved in switching to Unreal Engine from other engines, callouts for what you need to know, and best practices in 2025.

Want to find out more about Unreal Engine? Take a look here: unrealengine.com

#VideoGames, #GameDevelopment, #BestPractices, #CoreConcepts, #BeginnersGuide,  #UnrealEngine, #GDC2025
title: Crash Course for New Unreal Engine Developers | GDC 2025

author: Unreal Engine
description:
Watch this video recorded at GDC 2025 and learn how to build a mobile game in Unreal Engine.

This session aims to remove the fear and unknown from mobile game development in Unreal Engine. We break down key workflows in Unreal Engine for building cross-platform games, including performance optimization, UI, touch inputs, and Blueprints, as well as covering mobile-specific features like IAP, ad integration, and push notifications. 

We also explore new features added in the latest version of Unreal Engine specifically for mobile and peek into what’s coming in the future.

Want to find out more about creating mobile games in Unreal Engine? Check this out: unrealengine.com/uses/mobile-games

#MobileGames, #MobileGameDevelopment, #CrossPlatformGames, #PerformanceOptimization, #UI, #TouchInputs, #BlueprintVisualScripting, #IAP, #AdIntegration, #PushNotifications, #UnrealEngine, #GDC2025
title: Moving to Mobile: Workflows for Unreal Engine Mobile Development | GDC 2025

author: Unreal Engine
description:
Watch this video recorded at GDC 2025 and discover the advantages of using Unreal Editor for Fortnite (UEFN) to build a game. 

Find out what it means to be a developer in the Fortnite ecosystem and discover the wide opportunities for new and experienced game developers in the space. 

You’ll learn all about using current and upcoming features, how to bring over your UE skills, publishing your first game, and monetizing through the Island Creator program.

Want to find out more about creating games in UEFN? Take a look here: unrealengine.com//uses/uefn-unreal-editor-for-fortnite

#UnrealEditorForFortnite, #UEFN, #Fortnite, #Publishing, #Monetization, #IslandCreatorProgram, #GDC2025
title: Why Build with Unreal Editor for Fortnite (UEFN) | GDC 2025

author: Unreal Engine
description:
Watch this video recorded at GDC 2025 and learn how to create AAA-quality content with Unreal Editor for Fortnite (UEFN). 

This session takes a deep dive into UEFN’s most advanced features, used to build sophisticated islands and experiences within the Fortnite ecosystem. 

Find out Epic has leveraged UEFN tools including Verse to build new gameplay experiences like Ballistic and Reload. We explore ways to create custom UI, NPCs, and persistent data in your UEFN games. 

Want to find out more about creating games in UEFN? Take a look here: unrealengine.com//uses/uefn-unreal-editor-for-fortnite

#UnrealEditorForFortnite, #UEFN, #AAAGames, #Verse, #Fortnite, #Ballistic, #Reload, #UI, #NPCs, #GDC2025
title: Building AAA Content with Unreal Editor for Fortnite (UEFN) | GDC 2025

author: Unreal Engine
description:
Watch this video recorded at GDC 2025 and discover how Epic Online Services (EOS) can help you build healthy, happy multiplayer communities for your online games.  

With more games than ever incorporating multiplayer gameplay, ensuring a fair player experience is becoming increasingly difficult. 

Epic Online Services offers developers a robust set of features to help prevent online cheating, get help from player communities to report on bad actors, and apply penalties to said bad actors. 

In this session, we provide guidance and best practices for using Epic Online Services Easy Anti-Cheat, Sanctions, and Player Reporting, and how the combination of these features can help make your multiplayer experiences the best they can be.

Want to find out more about EOS? Take a look here: onlineservices.epicgames.com/services

#EpicOnlineServices, #EOS, #Multiplayer, #EasyAntiCheat, #Sanctions, #PlayerReporting, #GDC2025
title: Fostering Healthy Multiplayer Communities with EOS Easy Anti-Cheat and Moderation | GDC 2025

author: Unreal Engine
description:
Watch this video recorded at GDC 2025 and discover the tools in Unreal Engine that can make for faster, more efficient development.

We explore how best to leverage the features and systems available today in UE 5.5—and those coming in future releases—to reduce your project iteration turnaround times, focusing on cooking, builds, and on-target deployment.

Want to find out more about Unreal Engine? Take a look here: www.unrealengine.com

#Development, #Cooking, #Builds, #OnTargetDeployment, #UnrealEngine, #GDC2025
title: Developer Iteration and Efficiency in Unreal Engine | GDC 2025
